text:
Job Title: CRM Developer
Company: Woodward-Williams
Location: Remote (with occasional on-site meetings)

Company Background: Woodward-Williams is a leading provider of customer relationship management (CRM) solutions, dedicated to helping businesses build strong, lasting relationships with their customers. We're a dynamic, growth-oriented company that values innovation, collaboration, and results-driven performance.

Job Description:

We're seeking an experienced CRM Developer to join our team. As a CRM Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our CRM system, ensuring seamless integration with our existing infrastructure. You will work closely with our cross-functional teams to identify business needs and develop solutions that meet those needs.

Responsibilities:

 Design, develop, and maintain our CRM system, ensuring data integrity and system performance
 Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and develop solutions
 Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to the CRM system
 Develop and maintain technical documentation
 Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies

Qualifications and Experience:

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
 3+ years of experience in CRM development, with a focus on Salesforce.com
 Strong understanding of CRM architecture, data modeling, and system integration
 Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills

Perks and Benefits:

 We are committed to fair and equitable pay practices. The salary for this position ranges from $80,000 to $110,000 USD per year, based on your experience and skills.
 Comprehensive health insurance, including medical, dental, and vision coverage
 401(k) matching program
 Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options
 Ongoing training and professional development opportunities
 Collaborative, dynamic work environment
